qas.question: How much does Israel spend on foreign aid?
Israel has a history of providing what?

context: Israeli foreign aid ranks very low among OECD nations, spending <a0_0>less than 0.1%<a0_0/> of its GNI on foreign aid, as opposed to the recommended 0.7%. Individual international charitable donations are also very low, with only 0.1% of charitable donations being sent to foreign causes. However, Israel has a history of providing <a2_0>emergency aid<a2_0/> and humanitarian response teams to disasters across the world. Israel's humanitarian efforts officially began in <a1_0>1958<a1_0/>, with the establishment of MASHAV, the Israeli Ministry of Foreign Affairs Agency for International Development Cooperation.
